jobs.title: SDET (Python)
jobs.requisition_description:
Job title: SDET (Python)

Client: Fannie Mae

Location: Reston VA - In person interviews only

Contract Type- W2

 

About the Role:

In this role, you'll help shape the future of forecasting for one of the largest mortgage industry companies in the world. This is an exciting opportunity to join a team working with cutting-edge technology at an unparalleled scale. We are looking for a strong SDET who can help improve and manage test automation.


Requirements:
Strong knowledge of various phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Software Test Life Cycle (STLC).
Experience in Regression, Progression and Shakeout testing of Python and AWS based applications.
Experience working with PyTest, BDD (Behave, Cucumber, Gherkins).
Proficiency with Python and Cloud Services, particularly Amazon Web Services (AWS)..
Strong background in continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) processes.
Experience working in Agile development environments.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
High-energy, detail-oriented, and able to meet tight deadlines.
Ability to provide results with minimal supervision.
Able to write, present information, and respond to questions from stakeholders.
Capable of contributing individually and as a member of a team.

jobs.title: Python Developer
jobs.requisition_description:
Job title: Python Developer (Senior)

Location: Reston VA - In person interviews only

Contract Type-W2

 

 Job Description: 

The candidate should have expertise in Python Developer (Senior) with AWS development expertise using Pandas, Boto3, PySpark, PyTest, SQL
• AWS services: Lambda, S3, Step Functions, Glue, EC2, ECS, CloudFormation, RDS, CloudWatch, Redshift, REST API, Docker
• Python frameworks: Flask, Django, FastAPI
• API development experience
• Database interactions - block storage DBs, relational DBs, file storage
Additional skills required are: Git, Terraform, Jira, Confluence, and Agile.
It would be great if the candidates have experience with shell scripting, AWS CLI based executions, application builds and development of unit tests
Excellent communication (oral and written) skills are also required.

jobs.title: Financial and IT Modeling (Quantitative model) developer
jobs.requisition_description:
Role: Financial and IT Modeling (Quantitative model) developer

Client: Fannie Mae

Location: Reston, VA Only 

Contract Type-W2

 

 

Description:

 

Technical Skills

Proficiency in Python with strong experience using quantitative/statistical packages (NumPy, pandas, SciPy, statsmodels, scikit-learn, QuantLib).

Strong SQL skills for working with large mortgage/loan datasets.

Ability to design, implement, and optimize Monte Carlo simulations and time-series models.

Experience building, testing, and maintaining production-ready Python/Shell code with Git, unit testing, and CI/CD.

Hands on experience with AWS services like Amazon S3, AWS Lambda, AWS Batch, AWS Glue, AWS EMR, Cloudwatch and IAM , EC2

 

Quantitative Modeling Knowledge

Familiarity with Potential Future Exposure (PFE) methodologies for counterparty credit risk.

Understanding of interest rate modeling using time series techniques.

Basic understanding of derivative pricing and exposure dynamics.

Exposure to macro risk factor models relevant to mortgage portfolios.

 

Soft Skills

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

Ability to clearly communicate results and technical design to both modelers and business stakeholders.

 

Focused on manipulating data in a software engineering capacity. Some of that data might live in relational systems, but it's increasingly moving towards NoSQL systems and data lakes. Normalize databases and ascertain the structure of the data meets the requirements of the applications that are accessing the information. Construct datasets that are easy to analyze and support company requirements. Combine raw information from different sources to create consistent and machine-readable formats. Skills: This IT role requires a significant set of technical skills, including a deep knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and tools like Spark/Hive/Airflow.

 

Education/Experience

Master’s in Data Science, Computer Science, Applied Math, or Financial Engineering; or Bachelor’s in same fields with 5+ years of quantitative model development experience in Python, SQL.

jobs.title: Azure Data Engineer
jobs.requisition_description:
Senior Data Engineer
Open to Fully Remote (East Coast Hours)
 

 

Day to Day:

Our Client is seeking a Data Engineer to support one of our insurance clients in the Richmond, VA area and help scale data operations. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and is passionate about building robust data pipelines using modern cloud technologies. You will play a key role in developing ETL processes using Python, integrating with Azure Data Factory, and leveraging Databricks for scalable data solutions. The team currently lacks deep expertise in Python and Databricks, so your contributions will be instrumental in filling this gap and elevating the team’s technical capabilities.

  • Design, develop, and maintain ETL pipelines using Python.
  • Integrate data workflows into Azure Data Factory.
  • Build and optimize scalable data solutions in Databricks.
  • Collaborate with team members to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
  • Provide mentorship and technical guidance on Python and Databricks best practices.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues across the pipeline.
  • Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and team meetings.
 

 

 

Must Haves:

  • 10+ years of experience in data engineering roles
  • Strong proficiency in Python, especially for ETL development
  • Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory and Databricks
  • Solid understanding of cloud-based data architecture and workflows

Plusses:

  • Experience in the insurance or financial services industry
  • Familiarity with Excess and Surplus lines data workflows
  • Exposure to other Azure services such as Azure Synapse or Azure SQL

jobs.title: Intern – UX Developer
jobs.requisition_description:
Intern – UX Developer

Location: Chantilly, VA
Duration: Internship (with potential for full-time opportunity)
Type: Full-time

About the Role

We are seeking a UX Developer Intern to join our internal projects team. The ideal candidate has a strong interest in creating intuitive, user-friendly interfaces and collaborating with developers and designers to deliver seamless digital experiences. This internship provides hands-on experience in UX design and development while working on real-world applications.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in designing and developing user interfaces that enhance usability and accessibility
  • Collaborate with frontend developers to implement designs in React.js and other frameworks
  • Conduct usability testing and gather feedback to improve user experience
  • Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to communicate design ideas
  • Optimize applications for responsiveness and performance
  • Stay up to date with UX/UI trends and best practices

Requirements

  • Pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Design, or related field
  • Knowledge of UI/UX principles, wireframing, and prototyping tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or similar)
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Understanding of responsive and accessible design
  • Strong communication skills and attention to detail

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience with React.js or frontend frameworks
  • Exposure to design systems and component libraries (Material-UI, Bootstrap, TailwindCSS)
  • Basic understanding of user research and usability testing

What We Offer

  • Hands-on experience building user-centered applications
  • Mentorship from experienced developers and designers
  • Opportunity to contribute to live internal projects
  • A collaborative, supportive work environment
  • Pathway to full-time employment upon successful completion

jobs.title: Intern – Business Analyst (Healthcare)
jobs.requisition_description:
Intern – Business Analyst (Healthcare)

Location: Chantilly, VA
Duration: Internship (with potential for full-time opportunity)
Type: Full-time

About the Role

We are seeking a Business Analyst Intern (Healthcare) to join our team and support internal healthcare IT and process improvement projects. The ideal candidate will have exposure to prior authorization workflows, medical analytics, 340B program requirements, and government healthcare programs (Medicare & Medicaid). This internship provides practical experience in analyzing healthcare business needs, supporting solution design, and working with cross-functional teams to deliver impactful outcomes.

Responsibilities

  • Work with business stakeholders to gather and document requirements for healthcare IT and process automation projects

  • Analyze workflows and processes related to prior authorization, medical analytics, 340B drug program, Medicare, and Medicaid

  • Support development of use cases, business rules, and process flows

  • Collaborate with developers, QA, and solution architects to ensure requirements are well understood and implemented

  • Conduct data analysis and reporting for healthcare operations and compliance needs

  • Assist in preparing presentations, business requirement documents (BRDs), and user stories for project teams

  • Participate in system testing and validation activities, ensuring solutions meet business and regulatory requirements

Requirements

  • Pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Healthcare Administration, Public Health, Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field

  • Exposure to healthcare programs such as prior authorization workflows, Medicare, Medicaid, 340B, and medical analytics

  • Strong analytical and documentation skills with attention to detail

  • Familiarity with healthcare regulatory frameworks and payer/provider workflows

  • Ability to work with cross-functional teams in a collaborative environment

  • Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word); familiarity with tools like JIRA, Confluence, or Visio is a plus

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Knowledge of healthcare interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)

  • Exposure to healthcare IT systems such as EMR/EHR platforms (e.g., EPIC, Cerner)

  • Basic SQL or data querying skills for analytics

  • Prior internship or project experience in healthcare analytics or payer/provider systems

What We Offer

  • Hands-on experience with real-world healthcare IT and business analysis projects

  • Exposure to Medicare/Medicaid, Prior Authorization, and 340B program processes

  • Mentorship from experienced healthcare IT professionals and business analysts

  • A collaborative, supportive learning environment

  • Pathway to full-time employment upon successful completion

jobs.title: Intern – Generative AI (GenAI) Developer
jobs.requisition_description:
Intern – Generative AI (GenAI) Developer

Location: Chantilly, VA
Duration: Internship (with potential for full-time opportunity)
Type: Full-time

About the Role

We are looking for a motivated Generative AI Developer Intern with prior experience in software engineering or machine learning and some exposure to Agentic AI. The ideal candidate has 3–4 years of hands-on experience in AI/ML development and is passionate about building next-generation intelligent solutions. This internship provides an opportunity to work on cutting-edge internal projects, including AI copilots, conversational bots, and automation frameworks.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and prototype GenAI applications using LLMs, RAG pipelines, and conversational frameworks
  • Experiment with Agentic AI workflows (planning, tool use, decision making) to enhance AI systems
  • Integrate AI models with APIs, databases, and cloud platforms
  • Build, test, and optimize pipelines for text, chat, and multimodal use cases
  • Collaborate with architects and senior developers on internal GenAI initiatives
  • Document research findings, experiments, and best practices

Requirements

  • 3–4 years of experience in software engineering, AI/ML development, or related fields
  • Strong programming skills in Python (knowledge of Java or JavaScript is a plus)
  • Exposure to Generative AI models (LLMs, transformers, embeddings) and frameworks such as LangChain or LangGraph
  • Basic understanding of Agentic AI concepts and experience with at least one Agentic AI project or experiment
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (any of GCP Vertex AI, AWS Bedrock, or Azure OpenAI)
  • Good problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS)
  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and model deployment
  • Understanding of API design (REST, GraphQL)
  • Prior work on chatbots, copilots, or automation tools

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to work on real-world GenAI projects
  • Mentorship from architects and senior AI developers
  • Hands-on exposure to Agentic AI workflows and enterprise AI use cases
  • A collaborative, innovative work environment
  • Pathway to full-time employment upon successful completion of internship

jobs.title: ServiceNow Vulnerability Management Engineer
jobs.requisition_description:
ServiceNow Vulnerability Management Engineer
We are seeking a Vulnerability Management Engineer to join our Global Security team. This role will drive enterprise vulnerability management initiatives, ensuring the security, compliance, and resilience of our infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with ServiceNow Vulnerability Response Module and a strong background in vulnerability scanning, prioritization, and remediation.
 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Define and implement vulnerability management and patching policies for on-premises infrastructure.

  • Perform vulnerability identification, severity assessment, prioritization, and remediation tracking.

  • Partner with cross-functional teams across time zones for onboarding to ServiceNow VRM, troubleshooting, and support.

  • Conduct impact assessments of vulnerabilities and propose mitigation strategies.

  • Recommend improvements to security processes, automation, and integration.

  • Query, analyze, and report on large datasets to highlight potential risks and trends.

  • Ensure proper exception handling and risk management practices.

Mandatory Skills:

  • Enterprise Vulnerability Management & Threat Management

  • ServiceNow Vulnerability Response & ServiceNow CMDB

  • Vulnerability Scanning, Analysis & Impact Assessment

  • Remediation Prioritization & Tracking

  • Risk Management & Exception Handling

  • Process Design and Security Automation

  • Strong skills in Data Analysis and reporting

  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with ability to collaborate across global teams

Preferred Experience:

  • Knowledge of industry-standard vulnerability scanning tools (e.g., Qualys, Tenable, Rapid7)

  • Familiarity with patch management processes and compliance frameworks

  • Experience in large-scale enterprise environments

jobs.title: Database Automation Engineer
jobs.requisition_description:
Position Title Job Description Location
Database Automation Engineer

We are seeking a skilled Database Automation Engineer to enhance and modernize our database infrastructure. The role focuses on identifying and automating existing manual processes to improve efficiency, scalability, and consistency across critical applications such as FIN-SP, RMA, and SNF. You will also play a key role in automation initiatives that expand and optimize the database services delivered by the squad.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Automate database processes to improve reliability, scalability, and performance.

  • Enhance database consistency across key applications (FIN-SP, RMA, SNF).

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for automation and implement effective solutions.

  • Contribute to continuous improvement of database services and automation frameworks.

  • Ensure high availability, disaster recovery, and performance tuning of databases.

  • Participate in code reviews, testing, and deployment of automation solutions.

  • Maintain strong documentation for automated workflows and database processes.

Mandatory Skills:

  • Database & Middleware: Oracle Database, RAC, SQL, Dataguard, GoldenGate

  • Automation & Tools: Ansible, Terraform, Maven, CloudBees, Bitbucket, YAML

  • Programming & OS: Python, Linux/Unix

  • Soft Skills: Strong collaborative communication skills, teamwork across diverse squads

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience in large-scale database environments.

  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.

  • Proven ability to identify gaps, streamline processes, and deliver automation solutions.

 [Manassas, VA, 20110]

jobs.title: ITSM Developer
jobs.requisition_description:
Sr. ITSM Developer

Fort Mill, SC or Austin, TX or NYC, NY

6 months (possible contract to hire)

 

We are seeking an experienced Senior ServiceNow Developer with deep expertise in IT Service Management (ITSM) to join our high-performing ServiceNow team. The ideal candidate will be a subject matter expert in Incident, Problem, Change, and the broader ITSM suite, and will have strong hands-on experience with Service Catalog, Service Portal, Virtual Agent, Flow Designer, and platform integrations.  This individual must also bring working knowledge of ServiceNow’s Artificial Intelligence capabilities, especially Predictive Intelligence, to help drive intelligent automation and smarter decision-making across the platform.

 

Required skills:

Building integrations

Strong foundational setup, change management from the ground up, incident/problem change

Building workspaces

 

Key Responsibilities:

•            Design, develop, and implement scalable solutions within the ServiceNow platform focused on ITSM capabilities.

•            Serve as the ITSM Subject Matter Expert, delivering best-practice configurations for Incident, Problem, Change, and Request workflows.

•            Build and optimize workflows using Flow Designer, emphasizing low-code automation best practices.

•            Develop and maintain Service Catalog items, custom widgets, and dynamic user experiences using the Service Portal.

•            Configure and enhance the Virtual Agent for self-service and automation scenarios.

•            Integrate ServiceNow with third-party systems using REST/SOAP APIs, IntegrationHub, and MID Servers.

•            Build and maintain custom Performance Analytics dashboards and reporting solutions to support operational and strategic metrics.

•            Ability to work independently, mentor junior developers, and engage with stakeholders across the enterprise.

________________________________________

Preferred Qualifications:

•            ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA)

•            ITSM Implementation Specialist certification

•            Experience with ITOM, CSM, or HRSD is a plus

•            Experience working in Agile / Scrum environments

jobs.title: Sr. ITAM Developer
jobs.requisition_description:
Sr. ITAM Developer

Fort Mill, SC or Austin, TX or NYC, NY (4 days onsite/week)

6 months (possible contract to hire)

 

 

Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior ServiceNow IT Asset Management (ITAM) Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in designing, configuring, and customizing ServiceNow’s ITAM suite, including Hardware Asset Management (HAM), Software Asset Management (SAM), and related integrations. This role requires a strong understanding of asset lifecycle management, license compliance, discovery/data integrations, and CMDB alignment. The Senior Developer will work closely with business stakeholders, architects, and process owners to deliver scalable solutions that improve visibility, reduce risk, and optimize asset utilization across the enterprise.

 

Required skills:

Experience is reporting and dashboards

Building integrations

Connecting Vendor management into HAM and SAM

 

Key Responsibilities:

• Design, configure, and customize ServiceNow ITAM modules (HAM Pro, SAM Pro, Discovery, Asset Workspace).

• Build and maintain integrations with procurement, vendor management, and inventory systems to ensure accurate asset data.

• Ensure proper alignment of ITAM data with the CMDB for accurate service mapping and dependency tracking.

• Support software license compliance and optimization, including reconciliation and audit readiness.

• Governance & Best Practices

• Champion ITAM governance, process maturity, and alignment with ITIL practices.

• Provide subject matter expertise on HAM and SAM capabilities, industry trends, and optimization opportunities.

• Provide production support, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis for ITAM-related issues.

• Identify opportunities for automation and continuous improvement within ITAM processes.

 

Required Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.

• 5+ years of ServiceNow development experience, with at least 2–3 years focused on ITAM (HAM Pro / SAM Pro).

• Strong knowledge of ITIL and ITAM practices (hardware lifecycle, software license models, vendor management).

• Proficiency in ServiceNow development: JavaScript, Flow Designer, IntegrationHub, APIs, MID Server.

• Hands-on experience with Discovery, CMDB, and normalization/reconciliation processes.

• ServiceNow certifications (CSA, CIS-HAM, CIS-SAM, CAD) strongly preferred.

jobs.title: Intern – EPIC Developer
jobs.requisition_description:
Intern – EPIC Developer

Location: Chantilly, VA
Duration: Internship (with potential for full-time opportunity)
Type: Full-time

About the Role

We are seeking an EPIC Developer Intern to support our internal healthcare IT initiatives. The ideal candidate will have some prior exposure to EPIC development or healthcare IT systems, with an interest in expanding their skills in building and integrating EPIC modules. This internship provides hands-on experience with EPIC programming, healthcare workflows, and system integration, working alongside EPIC-certified developers and architects.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in the design, development, and customization of EPIC modules under the guidance of senior EPIC-certified developers
  • Support integration between EPIC and other healthcare/enterprise systems (HL7, FHIR, APIs)
  • Develop, test, and maintain EPIC reporting tools (Clarity, Cogito, Chronicles)
  • Participate in requirements gathering sessions with business analysts and healthcare stakeholders
  • Document workflows, processes, and technical designs for assigned tasks
  • Troubleshoot and resolve basic EPIC-related issues with guidance from mentors

Requirements

  • Pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Healthcare IT, or related field
  • Past EPIC experience preferred (such as coursework, internships, or prior work with EPIC modules, reporting, or interfaces)
  • Strong programming foundation in at least one language (Python, Java, C#, or SQL)
  • Familiarity with healthcare workflows, EMR/EHR systems, and interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)
  • Strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Exposure to EPIC Hyperspace, Chronicles, Clarity, or Reporting Workbench
  • Knowledge of healthcare compliance standards (HIPAA, PHI handling)
  • Experience with APIs, data extraction, or integration in healthcare projects
  • Coursework or internship experience in healthcare IT

What We Offer

  • Hands-on exposure to EPIC development and healthcare IT projects
  • Mentorship from EPIC-certified developers and senior architects
  • Real-world experience with healthcare workflows and integrations
  • A collaborative, supportive learning environment
Pathway to full-time employment upon successful completion

jobs.title: Intern – Java Full Stack Developer (Java + React)
jobs.requisition_description:
Intern – Java Full Stack Developer (Java + React)

Location: Chantilly, VA
Duration: Internship (with potential for full-time opportunity)
Type: Full-time

About the Role

We are seeking a motivated Java Full Stack Developer Intern to join our internal projects team. The ideal candidate should have strong skills in Java and React.js, with hands-on exposure to Spring Boot microservices and an interest in microservices frameworks such as Chassis. This internship offers the opportunity to work on real-world projects, gain practical exposure, and contribute to innovative solutions in a collaborative environment.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and deploy full stack applications with a focus on Spring Boot–based microservices on the backend and React.js on the frontend
  • Collaborate with senior developers, architects, and project managers on internal product development
  • Build and consume RESTful APIs and integrate with databases and cloud-native tools
  • Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
  • Participate in code reviews, debugging, and unit/integration testing
  • Contribute to performance optimization and scalability of microservices-based applications
  • Research and experiment with emerging frameworks and technologies (e.g., Chassis, service meshes, containerization)

Requirements

  • Pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field
  • Strong knowledge of Java and backend frameworks, particularly Spring Boot
  • Understanding of microservices architecture and exposure to frameworks such as Chassis (or similar)
  • Frontend experience with React.js (hooks, state management, component design)
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6+), and REST APIs
  • Experience with relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)
  • Knowledge of version control systems (Git/GitHub)
  • Good communication skills and ability to work in a team-oriented environment

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Docker, or Kubernetes
  • Knowledge of testing frameworks (JUnit, Jest, etc.)
  • Previous experience working on real-world or academic full stack/microservices projects

What We Offer

  • Hands-on experience with live internal projects
  • Mentorship from experienced architects and developers
  • Opportunity to learn industry best practices in full stack and microservices development
  • A collaborative, supportive work environment
  • Potential for full-time employment upon successful completion of internship

jobs.title: Intern – Frontend Developer (React)
jobs.requisition_description:
Intern – Frontend Developer (React)

Location: Chantilly, VA
Duration: Internship (with potential for full-time opportunity)
Type: Full-time

About the Role

We are looking for a passionate Frontend Developer Intern with strong React.js skills to join our internal projects team. This role will give you hands-on experience building modern, responsive user interfaces and collaborating with senior developers to deliver high-quality solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain responsive, user-friendly web applications using React.js.
  • Collaborate with backend developers and designers to integrate APIs and ensure seamless user experiences.
  • Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code with attention to performance and scalability.
  • Participate in debugging, testing, and optimizing front-end features.
  • Assist in improving UI/UX based on user feedback and best practices.
  • Stay updated on emerging frontend technologies and frameworks.

Requirements

  • Pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
  • Strong knowledge of React.js (hooks, state management, reusable components).
  • Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6+).
  • Familiarity with REST APIs and JSON integration.
  • Understanding of responsive design and cross-browser compatibility.
  • Experience with Git/GitHub for version control.
  • Strong problem-solving and teamwork skills.

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Knowledge of UI/UX design principles.
  • Exposure to frontend libraries like Material-UI, Bootstrap, or TailwindCSS.
  • Familiarity with testing tools (Jest, React Testing Library).
  • Experience in academic or personal React projects.

What We Offer

  • Real-world experience working on internal projects.
  • Mentorship from experienced developers and architects.
  • A collaborative, supportive work environment.
  • Learning opportunities with the latest frontend tools and practices.
  • Potential for full-time employment after internship.

jobs.title: SAP PaPM
jobs.requisition_description:
Job Title – SAP PaPM

Location: Remote, Some Travel Needed to Minnesota

Contract Type: W2

  • Successfully completed 2-3 end-to-end SAP implementations using SAP PaPM
  • Hands-on experience with SAP S/4 FPSL & PaPM
  • Expertise in the integration between the S/4HANA Finance
  • The candidate will work closely with business and IT teams to support financial modeling, cost allocations, and profitability analysis using SAP PaPM
  • Integration with PaPM & FI, architect the data model in PaPM, support integration discussions, guide on standard capabilities in PaPM, and drive design of the business rules
  • Led PaPM implementation from Blueprint through Go-live and Hypercare. Designed and developed with focus on Quality, Usability, and Sustainability of the solution
  • Lead in defining the data model in PaPM, support integration discussions, guide on standard capabilities in PaPM, and drive design of the business rules
  • Develop and maintain financial data models, ensuring data integrity and flow within PaPM. Integrate PaPM with other SAP systems like S/4HANA and BW, as well as external data sources
  • Exposure to interfacing with non-SAP systems & mapping the user requirements. Lead the onsite and offshore team

 

 

  • Exposure to interfacing with non-SAP systems & mapping user requirements, leading onsite and offshore teams.
  • Prepared and ran demos leveraging SAP PaPM based on relevant use cases.
  • Functional end-to-end process in Allocations, Product Pricing & Costing, Profitability & Cost Management, Predictions & Simulations, Reconciliations.
  • Performed What-If analysis on important business drivers for profitability analysis and decision-making.
  • Expertise in data modeling, building and extending models, allocation/calculation functions, query function, parameters, performing ad-hoc simulations, activity-based costing, and top-down distribution.
  • Developed and implemented performance metrics, KPIs, and profitability models. Created and maintained reports and dashboards to provide insights into business performance.
  • Provided ongoing support, enhancements, and troubleshooting for existing PaPM configurations.
  • Ensured knowledge transfer from the client team and built and maintained a knowledge database for the new team.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of each year of education.
  • At least 11 years of experience with Information Technology.
  • The role may require travel to project locations.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer OR Fullstack Developer
jobs.requisition_description:
JD:
Java 8/11/17/21
Microservices/Spring Boot/ Rest API's
AWS (EC2, S3, IAM, SNS, SQS, fargate etc)
 
Core Java, Java8/11/17, Springboot,  AWS services are the only things we look for
AWS extensive experience also isn’t a huge dealbreaker but being able to navigate components like EC2, S3 are a must.. application this person would be supporting is fully hosted in cloud environment; person doesn’t need to be “expert” but also can’t have zero experience at same time
Seems AWS is the only area they can compromise, if the person is very proficient in other areas
Not a senior or Lead level position, but they definitely need someone that is a self-starter and doesn’t require extensive hand-holding
Can’t have someone that relies heavily on lead for delegating work, must be inquisitive and able to problem solve
Recent projects must not be short terms

OVERVIEW

  • Provide technical design, development, and implementation of large projects and/or major software products and systems.
  • Assist in defining architecture requirements and implementation for the design and development of Cloud solutions.
  • Develop strategic roadmaps that align software development efforts to mission outcomes.
  • Lead an integrated team of subject matter experts and IT specialists.
  • Serve as primary technical resource to the development and customer teams.
  • Act as team leader in prioritizing group tasks, determining individual assignments, and reviewing work of junior developers.
  • Provide technical guidance to developers following industry best practices.
  • Interact with customers regarding strategies, requirements, problem solving, and support.
  • Work with minimal supervision/guidance.

SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

·         Excellent collaboration and communication skills. Strong ability to mentor/coach team members as well as experience in influencing senior leadership.

·         At least 10+ years of experience in Java/J2EE and related technologies with solid understanding of design principles.

·         Experience with front-end technologies such as Angular, TypeScript, ReactJS and related technologies would be a plus.

·         Experience in developing Cloud (AWS) based capabilities including implementation, development and support experience.

·         Expert proficiency in unit testing as well as coding in 1-2 languages.

·         Experience with implementing integration solutions with Microservices, RESTful Web Services and Web APIs.

·         Expert proficiency in Object Oriented Design (OOD) and analysis.

·         Expert proficiency in application of analysis/design engineering functions.

·         Expert proficiency in application of non-functional software qualities such as resiliency, maintainability, etc.

·         Expert proficiency in advanced behavior-driven testing techniques.

·         Provide expertise for teams in all matters related to deployment, building and release process.

·         Experience leading and working in Agile Team.

Desired Skills

·         Experience as a Tech Lead and ability to provide technical guidance in designing and architecting critical software applications.

·         Knowledge of Microservices-based architecture is strongly desired.

·         Knowledge or experience in basic DevOps support and deployment.

·         AWS Certified is strongly preferred.

·         Expert proficiency in unit testing as well as coding in 1-2 languages.

·         Experience with implementing integration solutions with Microservices, RESTful Web Services and Web APIs.

·         Expert proficiency in Object Oriented Design (OOD) and analysis.

·         Expert proficiency in application of analysis/design engineering functions.

·         Expert proficiency in application of non-functional software qualities such as resiliency, maintainability, etc.

·         Expert proficiency in advanced behavior-driven testing techniques.

·         Provide expertise for teams in all matters related to deployment, building and release process.

·         Experience leading and working in Agile Team.

Desired Skills

·         Experience as a Tech Lead and ability to provide technical guidance in designing and architecting critical software applications.

·         Knowledge of Microservices-based architecture is strongly desired.

·         Knowledge or experience in basic DevOps support and deployment.

·         AWS Certified is strongly preferred.

jobs.title: SAP FPSL
jobs.requisition_description:
Job Title – SAP FPSL

Location: Remote, Some Travel Needed to Minnesota

Contract Type : W2

 

  • Successfully completed 2-3 end-to-end SAP implementations with extensive experience in FPSL. Minimum of 9 years of experience
  • Expertise in executing all business processes from a single source of truth
  • Hands-on experience with SAP S/4 FPSL & PaPM
  • Hands-on experience with SAP S/4 FSRI
  • Hands-on experience with SAP S/4 FSCD
  • Hands-on experience with SAP S/4 PSC
  • Expertise in the integration between the S/4HANA Finance
  • Experience in data conversion & ETL tools for S/4HANA
  • Expertise in new innovations in S/4HANA Fiori apps
  • Experience in IFRS 17 and SAP S/4HANA module FPSL (Financial Product Sub Ledger) for Insurance Contracts
  • Assess, design, and develop a working SAP FPSL Insurance solution - Register, Accrue, Defer, Write Down, Release, Value TC, Move & Transform, Value FX, Classify, Classify & PL, Disclose, Split revenue, Adjust, Carry Forward process
  • Exposure know-how with all three measurement types (GMM, PAA, and VFA)
  • SAP FPSL architecture and components like SDL, RDL, CVPM
  • FPSL process flow: Register, Accrue, Capture (Central GAAP) (periodic), Capture (Delta GAAP), Unwind and Release, Value TC, Recognize Profit, allocate (Secondary Costs) (time-series-based), Move and Transform, Value FX, Classify
  • Integration with PaPM & FI, architect the data model in PaPM, support integration discussions, guide on standard capabilities in PaPM, and drive design of the business rules.
  • Implemented various functions required for data source integration, data import, and data enrichment.
  • Led PaPM implementation from Blueprint through Go-live and Hypercare. Designed and developed with a focus on Quality, Usability, and Sustainability of the solution.
  • Assisted business users in designing and executing financial and business models by configuring and combining functions. Led the onsite and offshore team.
  • Defined the data model in PaPM, supported integration discussions, guided standard capabilities in PaPM, and drove the design of business rules.
  • Assisted business users in designing and executing financial and business models by configuring and combining functions.
  • Exposure to interfacing with non-SAP systems & mapping user requirements. Led the onsite and offshore team.
  • Prepared and ran demos leveraging SAP PaPM based on relevant use cases.
  • Functional end-to-end process in Allocations, Product Pricing & Costing, Profitability & Cost Management, Predictions & Simulations, Reconciliations.
  • Performed What-If analysis on important business drivers for profitability analysis and decision-making.
  • Expertise in data modeling, building and extending models, allocation/calculation functions, query function, parameters, performing ad-hoc simulations, activity & process-based costing, and top-down distribution.

jobs.title: SAP FSCD Consultant
jobs.requisition_description:
Job Description – SAP FSCD Consultant

Role Overview:
The SAP FSCD Consultant will be responsible for implementing, configuring, and supporting the SAP Financial Services – Collections and Disbursements (FSCD) module. The role involves working closely with business stakeholders to analyze requirements, design solutions, and ensure smooth integration with other SAP and non-SAP systems.

Key Responsibilities:
	•	Gather and analyze business requirements related to collections, disbursements, and payment processing.
	•	Configure FSCD components such as:
	•	Business Partner Integration
	•	Payment Lots (Incoming & Outgoing)
	•	Direct Debit & Bank Transfers
	•	Dunning & Collections processes
	•	Integration with FI/GL, FI-CA, and Insurance modules
	•	Support end-to-end FSCD process design, from collections to disbursements.
	•	Develop functional specifications for enhancements, reports, and interfaces.
	•	Collaborate with technical teams (ABAP, PI/PO, etc.) for system developments.
	•	Perform system testing (unit, integration, UAT) and support cutover activities.
	•	Provide production support, troubleshoot issues, and ensure system stability.
	•	Document configurations, processes, and user training materials.

Skills & Qualifications:
	•	Strong hands-on experience in SAP FSCD configuration and support.
	•	Knowledge of insurance or financial services industry processes.
	•	Integration expertise with FI-CA, FI, SD, and Banking systems.
	•	Experience in payment processing, dunning, collections, and reconciliation.
	•	Ability to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
	•	Good problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.

Preferred:
	•	Experience in SAP S/4HANA FSCD.
	•	Familiarity with SAP Insurance modules (FS-PM, FS-ICM, FS-RI).
	•	Understanding of regulatory and compliance requirements in financial services.

jobs.title: SAP OneSource/Vertex
jobs.requisition_description:
JD:
We are seeking an experienced professional to take a hands-on role in driving SAP and third-party tax engine integrations (OneSource/Vertex). The role requires strong technical expertise, deep business process knowledge, and the ability to lead tax integration projects while collaborating with business leaders, vendors, and system integrators.
 
Roles & Responsibilities
• Apply functional and technical knowledge of SAP and third-party tax engines (OneSource, Vertex) to implement and support tax integration projects.
• Establish and maintain strong relationships with business leaders to drive engagement on major tax initiatives.
• Gather business requirements, lead analysis, and deliver high-level end-to-end design.
• Oversee configuration and development activities through internal teams and external vendors.
• Manage external software vendors and system integrators, ensuring compliance with SLAs.
• Act as domain lead for IT projects, ensuring stakeholder inclusion and effective communication.
• Provide leadership and mentorship to teams, integrating technical expertise and business understanding to deliver superior solutions.
• Follow formal system implementation methodologies across project phases: preparation, requirements gathering, design, build/test, and deployment.
• Support incident management, major incident resolution, and problem management.
 
Mandatory Skills
• SAP
• OneSource
• Vertex
• Indirect tax integration
 
Preferred Skills
• Indirect tax concepts
• SAP native tax
 
Key Behavioural Attributes / Requirements
• Hands-on experience in Tax Engine Integration (OneSource/Vertex/Avalara) with ERP systems (Oracle/SAP).
• Solid understanding of Indirect Tax Concepts.
• Good knowledge of O2C (Order-to-Cash) and P2P (Procure-to-Pay) processes.
• Experience in Tax Engine Configurations (OneSource or Vertex).
• Ability to troubleshoot tax-related issues and provide solution design.
• Knowledge of Avalara and VAT compliance is an added advantage.

jobs.title: Salesforce Developer
jobs.requisition_description:
JD:

Manager needs a strong salesforce developer with 10 years of experience in salesforce development. Not 10 years of overall experience.
Manager wants a candidate with Salesforce Certifications specifically Platform Development 1, Platform Development 2 and/or Salesforce Certified Technical Architect (CTA).

Description:

We are seeking a seasoned Senior Salesforce Developer with deep expertise in Salesforce platform development to lead and deliver enterprise-grade solutions in a fast-paced, agile environment. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker and problem solver, capable of translating complex business requirements into scalable and maintainable Salesforce applications.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the design, development, and deployment of custom Salesforce solutions using Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), Visualforce, and Salesforce APIs.
Collaborate with business stakeholders and cross-functional teams to define and implement efficient, end-to-end business processes.
Drive bi-weekly release cycles, ensuring high-quality deliverables and quick turnaround on enhancements and fixes.
Maintain and optimize existing Salesforce implementations, ensuring performance, scalability, and security.
Mentor junior developers and contribute to code reviews, technical design sessions, and architectural decisions.
Ensure alignment of Salesforce solutions with enterprise architecture and strategic IT goals.

Required Skills:
Minimum 10+ years of hands-on Salesforce development experience.
Expertise in Apex, LWC, SOQL/SOSL, Flows, Process Builder, and custom metadata types.
Strong understanding of Salesforce data model, security model, and integration patterns (REST/SOAP APIs, Platform Events).
Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments with bi-weekly sprint cycles and CI/CD pipelines.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, quickly analyze issues, and deliver effective solutions under tight deadlines.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Salesforce certifications such as Platform Developer I/II, Application Architect, or System Architect are highly preferred.
10+ years of overall IT experience, with proven leadership in enterprise-level projects.

jobs.requisition_description:
FL-DOE-OSFA-Budget Analysts-Policy Analyst

FL-DOE-OSFA-Budget Analysts-Policy Analyst

Pay Rate $40.00, Vendor Rate $52.00

WORK ENVIRONMENT:  Professional office

CANDIDATE RESPONSIBILITIES:

·       Maintains various specialized accounting records

·       Compiles and analyses of large amounts of financial data

·       Ability to read and interpret statutes and regulations

·       Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) & Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) Pronouncements

·       Understanding of Genal Ledgers, Trail Balances, and GAAP Financial Statements

·       Knowledge of Microsoft (ex. Excel, Word, Access, etc.)

Skill Required /Desired Amount of Experience
